Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the amended protocol that indicates the amendment,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the protocol submitted under paragraph 66(a),

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the rationale for the amendment,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of the research ethics board that approved the amended protocol, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number and, if applicable, the facsimile number and electronic mail address of any research ethics board that has previously refused to approve any amendment to the protocol, its reasons for doing so and the date on which the refusal was given;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in paragraph (1)(e), a copy of the amended investigator’s brochure or an addendum to the investigator’s brochure that indicates the new information, including supporting toxicological studies and clinical trial safety data, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of an amendment referred to in paragraph (1)(f), a copy of the amended chemistry and manufacturing information that indicates the amendment, and the rationale for that amendment.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall amend the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor submits an application for amendment to the Minister that is in accordance with subsection (3);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor provides the Minister with all additional information or samples requested under section 73; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe, based on an assessment of the application for amendment, an assessment of any samples or information submitted under section 73 or a review of any other information that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the use of the natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial will not endanger the health of a clinical trial subject or other person,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the clinical trial is not contrary to the best interests of the clinical trial subjects, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the objectives of the clinical trial will be achieved.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall amend the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial by sending the sponsor a notice of the amendment.

Section.Text: If an authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial is amended in accordance with subsection 71(5), the sponsor shall sell or import the natural health product and conduct the clinical trial in accordance with the amended authorization.

If the information and documents submitted in respect of an application under section 66 or an application for amendment under subsection 71(3) are insufficient to enable the Minister to determine whether the sale or importation of the natural health product should be authorized or whether the authorization should be amended, as the case may be, the Minister may request that the sponsor provide the Minister with samples of the natural health product or additional information relevant to the natural health product or the clinical trial that are necessary to make the determination.
Every sponsor shall ensure that a clinical trial is conducted in accordance with good clinical practices and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is scientifically sound and clearly described in a protocol;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is conducted, and the natural health product is used, in accordance with the protocol and this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: systems and procedures that assure the quality of every aspect of the clinical trial are implemented;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, the approval of a research ethics board is obtained before the clinical trial begins at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: at each clinical trial site, there is no more than one qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: at each clinical trial site, medical care and medical decisions, in respect of the clinical trial, are under the supervision of the qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each individual involved in the conduct of the clinical trial is qualified by education, training and experience to perform his or her respective tasks;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: written informed consent, given in accordance with the applicable laws governing consent, is obtained from every person before that person participates in the clinical trial but only after that person has been informed of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the risks and anticipated benefits to his or her health arising from participation in the clinical trial, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: all other aspects of the clinical trial that are necessary for that person to make the decision to participate in the clinical trial;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the requirements respecting information and records set out in section 76 are met; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product is manufactured and stored in accordance with the requirements set out in Part 3 except for section 61.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall ensure that the natural health product bears a label that sets out the following information in both official languages:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement indicating that the natural health product is an investigational natural health product to be used only by a qualified investigator;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name or code of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended storage conditions for the natural health product, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the sponsor; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the protocol code or identification.

Subsection.Text: Sections 86 to 94 do not apply to a natural health product used for the purposes of a clinical trial.
The sponsor shall record, handle and store all information in respect of a clinical trial in a way that allows its complete and accurate reporting as well as its interpretation and verification.
The sponsor shall maintain complete and accurate records to demonstrate that the clinical trial is conducted in accordance with good clinical practices and these Regulations.
The sponsor shall maintain complete and accurate records in respect of the use of a natural health product in a clinical trial, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of all versions of the investigator’s brochure for the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting each change made to the investigator’s brochure, including the rationale for each change and documentation that supports each change;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting all adverse events in respect of the natural health product that have occurred inside or outside Canada, including information that specifies the dosage form and the use and purpose of the natural health product at the time of the adverse event;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting the enrolment of clinical trial subjects, including information sufficient to enable all clinical trial subjects to be identified and contacted in the event that the sale of the natural health product may endanger the health of the clinical trial subjects or other persons;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: records respecting the shipment, receipt, disposition, return and destruction of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, an undertaking from the qualified investigator that is signed and dated by the qualified investigator prior to the commencement of his or her responsibilities in respect of the clinical trial, that states that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the qualified investigator will conduct the clinical trial in accordance with good clinical practices, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the qualified investigator will immediately, on discontinuance of the clinical trial by the sponsor, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, notify both the clinical trial subjects and the research ethics board of the discontinuance, provide them with the reasons for the discontinuance and advise them in writing of any potential risks to the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, a copy of the protocol, informed consent form and any amendment to the protocol or informed consent form that have been approved by the research ethics board for that clinical trial site;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial site, an attestation, signed and dated by the research ethics board for that clinical trial site, stating that it has reviewed and approved the protocol and informed consent form and that the board carries out its functions in a manner consistent with good clinical practices; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: for each clinical trial referred to in an application submitted under section 66 or subsection 71(3), the information referred to in subparagraph 66(c)(ix) and paragraph 66(f).

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall maintain all records referred to in this Part for a period of 15 years.

The Minister shall require a sponsor to provide, within two days after the day on which the request is received, information concerning the natural health product or the clinical trial, or samples of the natural health product, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial endangers the health of a clinical trial subject or other person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the clinical trial is contrary to the best interests of a clinical trial subject;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a qualified investigator is not respecting the undertaking referred to in paragraph 76(3)(f); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: information submitted or provided in respect of the natural health product or the clinical trial is false or misleading.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may require the sponsor to provide, within seven days after the day on which the request is received, any information or records referred to in section 76, or samples of the natural health product, in order to assess the safety of the natural health product or the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons.

During the course of a clinical trial, the sponsor shall notify the Minister of any serious adverse reaction and any serious unexpected adverse reaction to the natural health product that has occurred inside Canada as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is neither fatal nor life threatening, within 15 days after the day on which the sponsor becomes aware of the information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is fatal or life threatening, within seven days after the day on which the sponsor becomes aware of the information.

Subsection.Text: The sponsor shall, within eight days after the day on which the Minister is notified under paragraph (1)(b), provide the Minister with a complete report in respect of that information that includes an assessment of the importance and implication of any findings made.
If the sponsor discontinues a clinical trial in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, the sponsor shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister of the discontinuance within 15 days after the day of the discontinuance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with the reason for the discontinuance and its impact on the proposed or ongoing clinical trials in respect of the natural health product conducted in Canada by the sponsor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: as soon as possible, notify all qualified investigators of the discontinuance and of the reasons for the discontinuance, and advise them in writing of any potential risks to the health of clinical trial subjects or other persons; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each discontinued clinical trial site, stop the sale or importation of the natural health product as of the day of the discontinuance and take all reasonable measures to ensure the recovery of all unused quantities of the natural health product that have been sold.

Subsection.Text: If the sponsor discontinues a clinical trial in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, the sponsor may resume selling or importing the natural health product for the purposes of the clinical trial in its entirety or at the clinical trial site if, in respect of each clinical trial site where the sale or importation is to be resumed, the sponsor submits to the Minister the information referred to in subparagraphs 66(c)(ix) to (xi) and paragraphs 66(d) and (f).

Subject to subsection (2), the Minister may suspend the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has contravened these Regulations or any provisions of the Act relating to the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any information submitted or provided in respect of the natural health product or clinical trial is false or misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has failed to comply with good clinical practices; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has failed to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: provide information or samples of the natural health product as required under section 73 or 77, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: notify the Minister or provide a report under section 78.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 81, the Minister shall not suspend the authorization unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has sent the sponsor a notice that indicates whether the authorization is intended to be suspended in its entirety or at a clinical trial site and the reason for the intended suspension; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sponsor has not, within 30 days after the date of the notice referred to in paragraph (a), provided the Minister with information or documents demonstrating that the authorization should not be suspended on the grounds that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension did not exist, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the situation giving rise to the intended suspension has been corrected.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend the authorization to sell or import a natural health product for the purposes of a clinical trial, in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, before giving the sponsor an opportunity to be heard if, as a result of any circumstance, the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary to do so to prevent injury to the health of a clinical trial subject or other person.

If the Minister suspends the authorization under section 80 or 81, the Minister shall send the sponsor a notice that sets out the reason for the suspension, the day on which the suspension is effective and indicating whether the authorization is suspended in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, and the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate the authorization in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, as the case may be, if within 30 days after the day on which the suspension is effective the sponsor provides the Minister with information or documents demonstrating that the situation giving rise to the suspension did not exist or that it has been corrected; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cancel the authorization in its entirety or at a clinical trial site, as the case may be, if within 30 days after the day on which the suspension is effective the sponsor has not provided the Minister with the information or documents referred to in paragraph (a).

Section.Text: If the Minister cancels the authorization under paragraph 82(b), the Minister shall send the sponsor a notice that sets out the reason for the cancellation, the day on which the cancellation is effective and indicating whether the authorization is cancelled in its entirety or at a clinical trial site.
Any signature that is required by these Regulations to be shown on a record or document may be an electronic reproduction of the required signature.
Any record that is required to be maintained by these Regulations may be maintained in any electronic format from which a printed copy of the record can be produced.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell a natural health product unless it is labelled and packaged in accordance with these Regulations.
Despite subsection (1), a person may sell a natural health product that is not labelled and packaged in accordance with these Regulations if the sale is to a manufacturer or distributor.
If any of the following information is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of a natural health product, it shall be shown in both English and French:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of the information referred to in paragraphs (a) to (f) of the definition recommended conditions of use in subsection 1(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the common name and proper name of each medicinal ingredient and each non-medicinal ingredient that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the source material of a medicinal ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its storage conditions.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if the common name or proper name of a medicinal ingredient or the common name of a non-medicinal ingredient does not have an English or French equivalent and there is an equivalent name in another language, that equivalent name shall be shown.

Despite subsections (1) and (2), the common name of a non-medicinal ingredient may be replaced by the International Nomenclature Cosmetic Ingredient name assigned to it in the International Cosmetic Ingredient Dictionary and Handbook, published in Washington, D.C., United States, by the Personal Care Products Council, as amended from time to time.
The statements, information and declarations required by these Regulations to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: clearly and prominently displayed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: readily discernible to the purchaser or consumer of the natural health product under the customary conditions of purchase and use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in characters of a single colour of type that is a visual equivalent of 100% solid black type on a white background or a uniform neutral background with maximum 5% tint of colour;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in characters of a standard sans serif font that is not decorative;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in characters that are not in contact with each other or with the features of any tables that are required to be shown under paragraph 93.1(1)(f);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if they relate to a non-medicinal ingredient, in characters of a type size of at least 5.5 points or, if condensed, of at least 5 points; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if they do not relate to a non-medicinal ingredient, in characters of a type size of at least 6 points or, if condensed, at least 5.5 points.

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs (1)(c) to (g) do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the lot number, product number or brand name; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the statements, information and declarations required to be shown on

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the inner label, if the available surface area for the inner label is 90 cm² or less; or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the outer label, if the available surface area for the outer label is 90 cm² or less.

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs (1)(c) to (g) do not apply if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the entire quantity of the natural health product is to be used within one day or less in accordance with the directions on the label; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the immediate container of the natural health product contains no more than three recommended dosage units.

Section.Text: Every lot number required by these Regulations to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall be preceded by one of the following designations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot number”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot No.”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “Lot”; or

Section.Text: Every product number required by these Regulations to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a homeopathic medicine, be preceded by the designation “DIN-HM”; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, be preceded by the designation “NPN”.

Section.Text: The requirement in subsection 93.1(11) and paragraphs 93.4(h) and 93.6(1)(h) to show the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement on a label of a natural health product does not apply if the food allergen, gluten or added sulphites are present in a natural health product as a result of cross-contamination.
The source of a food allergen that is required to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall be shown as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in one of paragraphs (a), (b) and (e) of the definition food allergen in subsection 1(1) or derived from that food, by the name of the food as shown in the applicable paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (c) of the definition food allergen in subsection 1(1) or derived from that food, by the name “sesame”, “sesame seed” or “sesame seeds”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in one of paragraphs (d) and (f) of the definition food allergen in subsection 1(1) or derived from that food, by the name of the food as shown in the applicable paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (g) of the definition food allergen in subsection 1(1) or derived from that food, by the name “soy”, “soya”, “soybean” or “soybeans”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from a food referred to in one of paragraphs (h) to (j) of the definition food allergen in subsection 1(1) or derived from that food, by the common name of the food referred to in item 6, 23 or 24, column 2, of table 1 of the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document, whichever is applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for a food allergen from the food referred to in paragraph (k) of the definition food allergen in subsection 1(1) or derived from that food, by the name “mustard”, “mustard seed” or “mustard seeds”.

Section.Text: The source of gluten that is required to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall be shown as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the source of gluten is shown in the list of non-medicinal ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for gluten from the grain of a cereal referred to in one of subparagraphs (a)(i) to (v) of the definition gluten in subsection 1(1) or derived from that grain, by the name of the cereal as shown in the applicable subparagraph, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for gluten from the grain of a hybridized strain created from one or more of the cereals referred to in subparagraphs (a)(i) to (v) of the definition gluten in subsection 1(1) or derived from that grain, by the names of the cereals as shown in the applicable subparagraphs; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the source of gluten is shown in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, by the name of the cereal in accordance with subparagraph (a)(i) or (ii), in parentheses, immediately following the word “gluten”.

Section.Text: The added sulphites that are required to be shown on a label of a natural health product shall be shown as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the added sulphites are shown in the list of non-medicinal ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by the name “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: individually by the applicable name set out in item 21, column 1, of table 2 of the Common Names for Ingredients and Components Document, except that the name “sodium dithionite”, “sulphur dioxide” or “sulphurous acid” must be followed, in parentheses, by the name “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the added sulphites are shown in a food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, by the name “sulfites”, “sulfiting agents”, “sulphites” or “sulphiting agents”.

Section.Text: No reference, direct or indirect, to the Act, the Food and Drug Regulations or to these Regulations shall be made on any label of or in any advertisement for a natural health product unless the reference is specifically required by law.

The following information in respect of a natural health product shall be shown on the principal display panel of the inner label and, if there is an outer label, on the principal display panel of the outer label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its brand name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its product number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its dosage form;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if it is sterile, the words “sterile” and “stérile”; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the net amount in the immediate container in terms of weight, volume or number.

Subsection.Text: The following information in respect of a natural health product shall be shown on the outer label or, if there is no outer label, on the inner label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the product is not imported, the name of the product licence holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the product is imported, the name of the product licence holder or importer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended route of administration;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its lot number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its expiry date; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a bilingual table entitled “Product Facts / Info-produit” or “Drug Facts / Info-médicament”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: two tables, one in English entitled “Product Facts” and one in French entitled “Info-produit”, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: two tables, one in English entitled “Drug Facts” and one in French entitled “Info-médicament”.

Subsection.Text: Any table that is referred to in paragraph (1)(f) shall be shown on the label vertically or horizontally.
Despite paragraph (1)(f) and subsection (4), the order of the languages in a bilingual table may be reversed.
A bilingual table shall contain only the following headings in the following order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Medicinal ingredients / Ingrédients médicinaux”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Uses / Usages”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “Warnings / Mises en garde”;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “Directions / Mode d’emploi”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “Other information / Autres renseignements”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: “Non-medicinal ingredients / Ingrédients non médicinaux”; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: “Questions?”.

Subsection.Text: A table in English shall contain only the following headings in the following order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Medicinal ingredients”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Uses”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “Warnings”;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “Directions”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “Other information”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: “Non-medicinal ingredients”; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: “Questions?”.

Subsection.Text: A table in French shall contain only the following headings in the following order:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Ingrédients médicinaux”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Usages”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “Mises en garde”;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “Mode d’emploi”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: “Autres renseignements”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: “Ingrédients non médicinaux”; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: “Questions?”.

Subsection.Text: The following information shall be shown under the heading “Medicinal ingredients / Ingrédients médicinaux” or under the headings “Medicinal ingredients” and “Ingrédients médicinaux”:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the medicinal ingredients of the natural health product that sets out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name of each ingredient or, if the proper name is the chemical name, the common name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of each ingredient per dosage unit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the authorized potency of each ingredient; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the source material of each medicinal ingredient of the natural health product.

Subsection.Text: At least one recommended use or purpose of the natural health product shall be shown under the heading “Uses / Usages” or under the headings “Uses” and “Usages”.

Despite subsections (4), (5), (6) and (8), the recommended use or purpose may be omitted from the table if that information is shown elsewhere on the same label, and, if it is omitted, the heading “Uses / Usages” or the headings “Uses” and “Usages” shall also be omitted.

The risk information, including any cautions, warnings, contra-indications or known adverse reactions associated with the use of the natural health product, shall be shown under the heading “Warnings / Mises en garde” or under the headings “Warnings” and “Mises en garde” and, subject to subsections (11) and (12), may be shown in bold type.

If the natural health product contains a food allergen, gluten or added sulphites, the statement “Allergens / Allergènes” or the statements “Allergens” and “Allergènes” shall be shown in bold type under the heading “Warnings / Mises en garde” or under the headings “Warnings” and “Mises en garde”, followed by the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, also in bold type.

If the natural health product contains aspartame, the statement “Contains aspartame / Contient de l’aspartame” or the statements “Contains aspartame” and “Contient de l’aspartame” shall be shown in bold type under the heading “Warnings / Mises en garde” or under the headings “Warnings” and “Mises en garde”.

Despite subsections (4), (5) and (6), if there is no risk information, including any cautions, warnings, contra-indications or known adverse reactions associated with the use of the natural health product, the heading “Warnings / Mises en garde” or the headings “Warnings” and “Mises en garde” shall be omitted from the table.
The following information in respect of the natural health product shall be shown under the headings “Directions / Mode d’emploi” or under the headings “Directions” and “Mode d’emploi”:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended dose; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended duration of use, if any.

Subsection.Text: The recommended storage conditions of the natural health product shall be shown under the heading “Other information / Autres renseignements” or under the headings “Other information” and “Autres renseignements”.

Despite subsections (4), (5), (6) and (15), the recommended storage conditions may be omitted from the table if they are shown elsewhere on the same label, and, if they are omitted and no information is to be included under the heading “Other information / Autres renseignements” or the headings “Other information” and “Autres renseignements”, the heading or headings shall also be omitted.
The following information shall be shown under the heading “Non-medicinal ingredients / Ingrédients non médicinaux” or under the headings “Non-medicinal ingredients” and “Ingrédients non médicinaux”:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a qualitative list, by common name, of the non-medicinal ingredients of the natural health product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the natural health product contains mercury or any salts or derivatives of mercury as a non-medicinal ingredient, a statement that sets out the quantities of those ingredients.

Subsection.Text: The telephone number, email address or website address of a contact person who represents the product licence holder of the natural health product shall be shown under the heading “Questions?”.

Section.Text: The following requirements apply in respect of a table referred to in paragraph 93.1(1)(f):

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the title shall be separated by a solid black line from the other information in the table;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: each heading and the information that is shown under it shall be separated by a solid black line from any subsequent heading;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the type size of the characters of the title shall be larger than that of each heading;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the type size of the characters of each heading shall be larger than that of the information that is shown under each heading;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the title and the headings shall be in bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the information that is shown under each heading shall be in regular type, except as otherwise provided; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the title, the headings and the information that is shown under each heading shall all be shown in the same font type.

Subsection.Text: If, despite the following measures, the available surface area for a label is insufficient to accommodate all of the information that is required to be shown in a table under section 93.1, the information required to be shown under subsection 93.1(17) shall be shown elsewhere on the same label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use of a bilingual table;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the use of condensed characters of a type size of at least 5 points to show information that is related to non-medicinal ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the use of condensed characters of a type size of at least 5.5 points to show information that is not related to non-medicinal ingredients.

Subsection.Text: If, despite the application of subsection (1), the available surface area for the label is insufficient to accommodate all of the remaining information that is required to be shown in the table, the information required to be shown under subsection 93.1(17) shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in a leaflet that is affixed or attached to the outermost container of the natural health product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in a package insert; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: on a website.

Subsection.Text: If, despite the application of subsection (2), the available surface area for the label is insufficient to accommodate all of the remaining information that is required to be shown in the table, the information required to be shown under paragraph 93.1(7)(b) shall be shown in the leaflet or package insert, or on the website, that contains the information required to be shown under subsection 93.1(17).

For the purposes of subsections (1), (2) and (3), the table shall include a statement under the title “Product Facts / Info-produit” or “Product Facts” and “Info-produit” that indicates where the information required to be shown under subsection 93.1(17), and, if applicable, paragraph 93.1(7)(b), can be found.
The information that is required to be shown in a package insert or on a website shall appear in a table that complies with the requirements of sections 93.1 and 93.2.

Section.Text: If a natural health product has both an inner and outer label, the following information in respect of the product shall be shown on the inner label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the product is not imported, the name of the product licence holder and the telephone number, email address or website address of the contact person who represents the product licence holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the product is imported, the name of the product licence holder or importer and the telephone number, email address or website address of the contact person who represents the product licence holder or importer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of its medicinal ingredients that sets out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name of each ingredient or, if the proper name is the chemical name, the common name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of each ingredient per dosage unit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the authorized potency of each ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: at least one of its recommended uses or purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended route of administration;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended dose;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended duration of use, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if it contains a food allergen, gluten or added sulphites, the statement “Allergens / Allergènes” or the statements “Allergens” and “Allergènes” in bold type, followed by the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, also in bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if it contains aspartame, the statement “Contains aspartame / Contient de l’aspartame” or the statements “Contains aspartame” and “Contient de l’aspartame” in bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any other risk information, including any cautions, warnings, contra-indications or known adverse reactions associated with its use;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended storage conditions, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: its lot number; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: its expiry date.

Section.Text: Sections 93.1 to 93.4 do not apply in respect of a natural health product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the available surface area for the outer label — or, if there is no outer label, for the inner label — is 90 cm² or less;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the entire quantity of the product is to be used within one day or less in accordance with the directions on the label;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the immediate container contains no more than three recommended dosage units; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the product has a localized effect and is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: recommended to be used in the oral cavity or on the skin,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: recommended for aromatherapy,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: recommended for organotherapy,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a throat lozenge,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a topical nasal decongestant or counterirritant, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a flower essence.

Subsection.Text: If any of the conditions set out in section 93.5 is met, the following information in respect of the natural health product shall be shown on the inner label and, if there is an outer label, on the outer label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the product is not imported, the name of the product licence holder and the telephone number, email address or website address of a contact person who represents the product licence holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the product is imported, the name of the product licence holder or importer and the telephone number, email address or website address of a contact person who represents the product licence holder or importer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of its medicinal ingredients that sets out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the proper name of each ingredient or, if the proper name is the chemical name, the common name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of each ingredient per dosage unit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the authorized potency of each ingredient;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: at least one of its recommended uses or purposes;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended route of administration;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended dose;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended duration of use, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if it contains a food allergen, gluten or added sulphites, the statement “Allergens / Allergènes” or the statements “Allergens” and “Allergènes” in bold type, followed by the food allergen source, gluten source and added sulphites statement, also in bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if it contains aspartame, the statement “Contains aspartame / Contient de l’aspartame” or the statements “Contains aspartame” and “Contient de l’aspartame” in bold type;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any other risk information, including any cautions, warnings, contra-indications or known adverse reactions associated with its use;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: its recommended storage conditions, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: its lot number; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: its expiry date.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), if any of the conditions set out in section 93.5 is met, the following information in respect of the natural health product shall be shown on the outer label or, if there is no outer label, on the inner label:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a qualitative list, by common name, of the non-medicinal ingredients that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it contains mercury or any salts or derivatives of mercury as a non-medicinal ingredient, a statement that sets out the quantities of those ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the source material of each medicinal ingredient that it contains.

Subsection.Text: The information referred to in paragraphs (2)(a) and (b) shall be shown in a leaflet that is affixed or attached to the outermost container of the natural health product, in a package insert or on a website if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case described in paragraph 93.5(d), the available surface area for the label is insufficient to accommodate the information that is required to be shown under subsections (1) and (2), despite the use of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: condensed characters of a type size of at least 5 points for information that is related to non-medicinal ingredients; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: condensed characters of a type size of at least 5.5 points for information that is not related to non-medicinal ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in all other cases, the available surface area for the label is insufficient to accommodate the information that is required to be shown under subsections (1) and (2).

Subsection.Text: If, despite the application of subsection (3), the available surface area for the label is insufficient to accommodate all of the remaining information that is required to be shown under subsections (1) and (2), the information referred to in paragraph (2)(c) shall be shown in the leaflet or package insert, or on the website, that contains the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(a) and (b).

For the purposes of subsections (3) and (4), the label shall include a statement that indicates where the information referred to in paragraphs (2)(a) and (b), and, if applicable, paragraph (2)(c), can be found.

If the immediate container of a natural health product is not large enough to accommodate an inner label that complies with the relevant requirements of sections 93 to 93.6, the product shall be labelled as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the inner label shall show the following in respect of the natural health product, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a brand name,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a qualitative list of its medicinal ingredients, by proper name, or by common name if the proper name is the chemical name, in descending order of quantity per dosage unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended dose,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended duration of use, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: its lot number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: its expiry date,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: its product number,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is sterile, the words “sterile” and “stérile”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the net amount in the immediate container in terms of weight, measure or number,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: its recommended use or purpose, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: if it does not have an outer label, a statement that refers the purchaser or consumer to the leaflet that is required in accordance with subsection (2); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the outer label, if any, shall comply with the relevant requirements of sections 93 to 93.6.

Subsection.Text: If the natural health product does not have an outer label,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the statements, information and declarations that would, but for subsection (1), be required to be shown on the inner label shall be shown in a leaflet that is affixed or attached to the immediate container; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if section 93.1 applies to the product, the tables required under that section, including the information in them, shall be shown in the leaflet in the manner described in that section and in section 93.2.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall sell or import one or more of the following natural health products that is packaged unless it is contained in a security package:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a mouthwash;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a product to be inhaled, ingested or inserted into the body; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a product for ophthalmic use.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to lozenges.
Subject to subsection (4), a statement or illustration that draws attention to the security feature of the security package referred to in subsection (1) shall be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the inner label; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the security feature is a part of the outer package, on the outer label.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (3) does not apply if the security feature of a security package is self-evident and is an integral part of the immediate container.

Section.Text: Sections A.01.061 to A.01.063 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.

Heading.TitleText: Cautionary Statements and Child Resistant Packages

Section.Text: Subsections C.01.001(2) to (4) and C.01.028(1), paragraphs C.01.028(2)(b) and (c), section C.01.029, subsection C.01.031(1), paragraphs C.01.031.2(1)(a) and (c) to (g), subsection C.01.031.2(2), and paragraphs C.01.031.2(3)(a) and (c) of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Section C.01.012 of the Food and Drug Regulations applies in respect of natural health products.
Sections A.01.022 to A.01.026 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Sections A.01.040 to A.01.044 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Section A.01.045 of the Food and Drug Regulations and Appendix III to those Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Sections A.01.050 and A.01.051 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.
Subsection C.01.015(1) and paragraphs C.01.015(2)(d) to (f) of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products.

Heading.TitleText: Sale of Natural Health Product for Emergency Treatment

Section.Text: Section C.08.010 and subsections C.08.011(1) and (3) of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products with the following modifications:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a reference to “new drug” is to be read as a reference to “natural health product”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the sale of a natural health product can only be authorized for human use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in subparagraph C.08.010(1)(b)(i), the reference to “adverse drug reactions” is to be read as a reference to “adverse reactions”;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph C.08.010(2)(c) is to be read as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has not, in respect of a natural health product, suspended the product licence under subsection 18(1) or section 19 of the Natural Health Products Regulations or cancelled the product licence under paragraph 20(b) of those Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in subsection C.08.011(1), the reference to “section C.08.002” is to be read as a reference to “subsection 4(1) of the Natural Health Products Regulations”; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in subsection C.08.011(3), the reference to “these Regulations” is to be read as a reference to the Natural Health Products Regulations.

Heading.TitleText: Public or Canadian Armed Forces Health Emergencies

Subsection.Text: Sections C.11.002 and C.11.003 of the Food and Drug Regulations apply in respect of natural health products for which a product licence has not been issued.

If the Minister issues an authorization to sell a specified quantity of a natural health product under subsection C.11.003(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations, any quantities of the drug that are sold in accordance with the authorization cease to be considered to be natural health products as of the time of sale.

Section.Text: A natural health product is exempt from subsection 3(1) of the Act with respect to its advertisement to the general public as a preventative, but not as a treatment or cure, for any of the diseases, disorders or abnormal physical states referred to in Schedule A.1 to the Act.

A natural health product is exempt from subsection 3(2) of the Act with respect to its sale by a person where the natural health product is represented by label or is advertised by that person to the general public as a preventative, but not as a treatment or cure, for any of the diseases, disorders or abnormal physical states referred to in Schedule A.1 to the Act.

Heading.TitleText: Distribution of Natural Health Products as Samples

Subsection.Text: If a practitioner or pharmacist has signed an order specifying the proper name or common name, the brand name and the quantity of a natural health product, the person who receives the order may distribute or cause to be distributed the natural health product, in dosage form, as a sample to that practitioner or pharmacist if the natural health product meets the requirements of these Regulations.
An order referred to in subsection (1) may provide that the order be repeated at specified intervals during any period that does not exceed six months.

Despite subsection (1), a person may distribute or cause to be distributed a natural health product, in dosage form, as a sample to a practitioner or pharmacist without a signed order if that natural health product has a localized effect and is for administration either in the oral cavity or on the skin, or is a throat lozenge, and if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product is part of a class of natural health products that is set out in column 1 of List A and contains, as its only medicinal ingredients, one or more of those set out in column 2, each of which corresponds to that class, in the corresponding quantity set out in column 3, and the natural health product is consistent with the descriptive information set out in columns 4 to 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the natural health product falls on a day that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 30 days after the day on which it is distributed, if the expiry date consists of a day, month and year, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a month that follows the month in which it is distributed, if the expiry date consists only of a month and year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product meets the requirements of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, practitioner and pharmacist have the same meaning as in subsection C.01.001(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: A person who, under subsection 103.4(1), receives an order for and distributes or causes to be distributed a natural health product as a sample shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain records showing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and description of each person to whom the natural health product was distributed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the brand name, quantity and dosage form of the natural health product distributed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the natural health product was distributed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: keep those records and all orders received for natural health products under subsection 103.4(1) for a period of not less than two years from the date on which the distribution referred to in the records was made.

Section.Text: A person may distribute or cause to be distributed a natural health product, in dosage form, as a sample to any consumer that is 18 years of age or older if that natural health product has a localized effect and is for administration either in the oral cavity or on the skin, or is a throat lozenge, and if all of the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product is part of a class of natural health products that is set out in column 1 of List A and contains, as its only medicinal ingredients, one or more of those set out in column 2, each of which corresponds to that class, in the corresponding quantity set out in column 3, and the natural health product is consistent with the descriptive information set out in columns 4 to 6;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date of the natural health product falls on a day that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 30 days after the day on which it is distributed, if the expiry date consists of a day, month and year,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a month that follows the month in which it is distributed, if the expiry date consists only of a month and year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the natural health product meets the requirements of these Regulations.

Heading.Label: PART 6
Heading.TitleText: Amendments, Transitional Provisions and Coming into Force

Section.Text: [Amendment]
[Amendment]
[Amendment]
[Amendment]

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 110, a person may, without complying with these Regulations, sell a drug to which these Regulations apply that is assigned a drug identification number in accordance with section C.01.014.2(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations, until the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which an application for a product licence in respect of the drug is disposed of or withdrawn, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: December 31, 2009.

Subsection.Text: A person who sells a drug under subsection (1) shall conduct that sale in accordance with the requirements of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: An application for a product licence that is made in respect of a drug referred to in subsection 108(1) on or before December 31, 2009 is not required to contain the information referred to in paragraph 5(g).

A sale or importation of a drug to which these Regulations apply that, before January 1, 2004, is authorized for the purposes of a clinical trial under Division 5 of Part C of the Food and Drug Regulations shall continue to be regulated under that Division.

Until December 31, 2009, a person may sell a lot or batch of a drug referred to in section 108 that is not labelled or packaged in accordance with the requirements of Part 5 if the lot or batch is packaged in accordance with the requirements of the Food and Drug Regulations.

If during the period beginning on January 1, 2004 and ending on December 31, 2005, the information referred to in section 22 is not available to the licensee prior to commencing the sale of the natural health product or within 30 days after the day on which the license is issued in respect of the natural health product, as the case may be, the licensee shall provide the information to the Minister immediately after it is available to the licensee.

Subsection.Text: A person who, before January 1, 2004, manufactures, packages, labels or imports for sale a drug to which these Regulations apply may continue to conduct the activity in respect of that drug without complying with the requirements of Parts 2 and 3, until the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which that person’s application for a site licence to conduct that activity in respect of the drug is disposed of or withdrawn, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: December 31, 2005.

Subsection.Text: A person who conducts an activity under subsection (1) shall conduct that activity in accordance with the requirements of the Food and Drug Regulations.

A person who, before January 1, 2004, distributes a drug to which these Regulations apply may continue to conduct the activity in respect of that drug without complying with the requirements of Part 3 until December 31, 2005.
A person who conducts an activity under subsection (1) shall conduct that activity in accordance with the requirements of Division 2 of Part C of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: A person may sell a lot or batch of a drug referred to in section 108 that is not manufactured, packaged, labelled, imported, distributed or stored, as the case may be, in accordance with the requirements of Part 3 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the lot or batch is manufactured, packaged and labelled before January 1, 2006; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any manufacturing, packaging, labelling, importation, distribution or storage of the lot or batch that is not conducted in accordance with the requirements of Part 3 is conducted in accordance with the requirements of Division 2 of Part C of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Except for section 6, these Regulations come into force on January 1, 2004.
Section 6 comes into force on July 1, 2004.

row.entry: A plant or a plant material, an alga, a bacterium, a fungus or a non-human animal material
An extract or isolate of a substance described in item 1, the primary molecular structure of which is identical to that which it had prior to its extraction or isolation
A synthetic duplicate of a substance described in any of items 2 to 5
A substance set out in Schedule C to the Act

Provision.Text: A substance set out in Schedule D to the Act, except for the following:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: a drug that is prepared from any of the following micro-organisms, namely, an alga, a bacterium or a fungus; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: any substance set out on Schedule D when it is prepared in accordance with the practices of homeopathic pharmacy

row.entry: A substance set out in any of Schedules I to V of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act
A substance that is administered by puncturing the dermis
An antibiotic prepared from an alga, a bacterium or a fungus or a synthetic duplicate of that antibiotic

Provision.Text: Cannabis as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act

row.entry: Anything referred to in Schedule 2 to the Cannabis Act that contains more than 10 μg/g THC, an isolated or concentrated phytocannabinoid or a synthetic duplicate of that phytocannabinoid
A drug that is manufactured, sold or represented for use in destroying or inactivating micro-organisms, or in reducing or controlling their number, on a non-living and non-liquid surface

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: former Regulations means the Natural Health Products Regulations as they read immediately before the day on which sections 17 to 22 of these Regulations come into force. (ancien règlement)
natural health product has the same meaning as in subsection 1(1) of the Natural Health Products Regulations. (produit de santé naturel)
new Regulations means the Natural Health Products Regulations as they read on the day on which sections 17 to 22 of these Regulations come into force. (nouveau règlement)

Subsection.Text: A natural health product for which a product licence has been issued under section 7 of the former Regulations is not required, within three years after the day on which sections 17 to 22 of these Regulations come into force, to be labelled in accordance with the new Regulations, if the product is labelled in accordance with the former Regulations.

If, during the three-year period referred to in subsection (2), a person that holds a product licence under the former Regulations in respect of a natural health product referred to in that subsection makes any modification of risk information referred to in paragraph 11(1)(c) of the former Regulations in respect of the product for the purpose of complying with the new Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 11 of the former Regulations does not apply in respect of the modification of risk information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the modification is to be considered as a change to which section 12 of the former Regulations applies.
